lead_paragraph: Mel Rosenthal, a photojournalist and teacher with a passion for social justice and the South Bronx neighborhood where he grew up, is retiring from Empire State College after 36 years. Our colleagues on Lens are giving him a sendoff including a slide show of his work and a Q. and A. about how he earned the trust of his subjects. "I was walking down street one day, some gang members saw me," Mr. Rosenthal recalls. "They said, 'What the hell you doing here?' One lifted up his pants. He had two Berettas strapped to his ankles. I said, 'Do you really need two guns?' " Read more on Lens »

headline.main: A Passion for Pictures, and for Social Justice
